results.title: The Lorax
results.creator_credit: DePatie-Freleng Enterprises, Isadore Freleng and Hawley Pratt
results.brief_description: Presents the story from the book “The Lorax” by Dr. Seuss. A fanciful tale with a serious theme: clean up the environment before it’s too late. In this delightful story the student is introduced to the needs of everyman. And the Lorax? Who is he and what does he do? Only Dr. Seuss can describe the creature - which he does with typical Seussian logic.

results.title: The Loon's necklace
results.brief_description: A re-creation of a legend of the Indians of British Colombia, using carved ceremonial masks of the Indians and animated drawings. The loon is a North American water bird. The story tells of Kelora, a blind medicine man. During a hard winter, his village suffers from famine, and is attacked by hungry wolves. Using his magic bow, Kelora is able to kill the wolves. In Spring, Kelora seeks out the loon, his “father”, and the loon gives him the power to see. In gratitude Kelora takes his most precious possession, a bead necklace, and throws it round the loon’s neck. That is how the loon came to get his collar of bright feathers.

results.title: The Longhouse people
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Allan Wargon
results.brief_description: The life and religious ceremonies of the Longhouse people - Iriquois Indians who adhere to the old religion. We see how the Iroquois of today, although fully adapted to the ways of the white people, still maintain a link with their proud past through observance of the customs and beliefs of their forefathers. Highlights of the film show an outdoor dance in supplication for rain, a healing ceremony performed by men of the False-Face Society and a dance in celebration of a newly chosen chief.

results.title: The Long way back
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Donald Ginsberg
results.brief_description: This film shows how the mental health volunteer fits into the treatment of mental illness. It shows that patients in a mental hospital respond more quickly to treatment if kept in touch with the outside world. A film of importance to mature men and women who may wish to offer their services as volunteers. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: The Long walk of Nelson Mandela
results.creator_credit: Story Street Productions, LLC, Unapix Entertainment Productions, David Fanning, Indra de Langerolle and Clifford Bestall
results.brief_description: This is an intimate portrait of one of the century’s greatest leaders told by those who have known and shared the more important moments of his life. However it is not just a narrative of Mandela’s life, its purpose is to examine how Mandela has risen above his very public personal trials and kept his eye unflinchingly on a distant and noble goal. Mandela’s life story and achievements are told through interviews with his contemporaries and friends and the use of archival footage.

results.title: The Long Wait of the Dragon
results.brief_description: Sport and physical culture in the People’s Republic of China. Covers the variety of sports and the training undertaken, and considers their readiness for the 1984 Olympic Games now that the International Olympic Committee has invited them to return to the Olympic movement

results.title: The Long wait
results.creator_credit: St John Ambulance (UK) and Maxwell Munden
results.brief_description: First-aid can save lives. Illustrates the importance of learning the elements of first aid as it follows two days in the life of Bill Jason, the “little man” to whom everything happens. Pointing its moral simply, the film sets out several important principles of first aid.

results.title: The Long view
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: The view from space has given us a total vision of our planet—a perspective and perception made possible through the development of remote-sensing technology in connection with Earth-orbiting satellites and aircraft. This film details some of the practical, down-to-earth applications of this technology and Canada’s activity in this field, particularly where it concerns the better management of natural resources and the environment. The capabilities are astonishing, and the need for responsible conservation is explicitly stated.

results.title: The Long line
results.creator_credit: Rank Screen Services, United Nations. Dept. of Public Information and Arnold Rabin
results.brief_description: This film is a comprehensive and dramatic account of the whole of the refugee problem. It includes sequences showing the escape of refugees across the Hungarian border, their experiences in camp and their final resettlement in their own homes. It also tells of the appointment of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and the formation of his office to handle refugee problems.

results.title: The Long journey
results.creator_credit: Rank Screen Services and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: Was has left its mark on Korea. Three million refugees joined the ranks of the homeless and hungry and the countryside was maimed and scarred. This film tells of Kim Tai Yung, a farmer from North Korea and one of those refugees who made their way to the South and freedom in 1951. As a background to Kim’s gradual progress the task of United Nations rehabilitation and reconstruction is seen to take shape and move into action.
